attributes.action: Introduce Pensions for the Brittish Armed Forces, Reserves.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We hereby call on the Government to introduce, pensions for all British Armed Forces reservists commencing on 5 years of service or on completion of two tours.
Most of the other areas such as, training, pay, attendance, and Deployments have increased over the years due to the situation's in the middle east.

Now, what i understand to be true you can sign up for the Army regulars on a special contract (s,contract) for one year on which you will be deployed twice on two, six month tours.

On completin of these tours and returning to your civilian life you will be entitled to the  pay and bennifits of a regular .

So this brings me to my point that lets say you were deployed 3 or 4 times in your career which is more than the special contract tours. why are we not entilted to a pension ?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
